- Many caf√©s offer English menus, but trying Ukrainian earns respect!

> üìú **History Bite:** Under Polish rule (16th-17th centuries), coffee houses became centers of intellectual life in Ukrainian cities like Lviv. This caf√© culture survived Soviet suppression and is thriving today. Each caf√© tells a story!

> üìú **Myth Buster:** Some claim caf√© culture in Ukraine is a "post-Soviet Western import." In reality, coffee houses existed in Ukraine centuries before the Soviet Union. The Soviets actually suppressed caf√© culture, seeing it as "bourgeois." Today's revival is a return to Ukrainian roots, not imitation of the West!
